intro: Bigelowia lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually narrow and linear, contributing to its drought-resistant nature.
